intro: Mesosphaerum tafallae, commonly known as the Tafalla mesosphaerum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
